text: Piwo wypite jakiś czas temu. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Provsmak på MBCC 2017. Rödrosa med ljusrosa skum. Syrlig doft av hallon. Bra syrliga hallon i smaken.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Ciemne i czerwone owoce, melasa, brązowy cukier, słodko-kwaskowate.

Bottle at home. Pours deep ruby brown, nose is raspberry, light funk, caramel, taste is juicy, tart raspberry, sour, sweet toffee. Raspberry obliterates the rest of the beer really, but its very tasty.

Ciemnobrązowe, nieprzejrzyste piwo, z beżową pianą. W zapachu maliny, pumpernikiel, karmel, rodzynki. W smaku chlebowe, malinowe, karmelowe, najpierw słodkie, w finiszu niespodziewanie kwaśne. Wysokie wysycenie. Bardzo oryginalne i smaczne piwo. Jestem pozytywnie zaskoczony.

Piwo o bardzo intensywnym aromacie chlebowym, piernikowym, malinowym, ciemnych owoców. W smaku niestety nie dzieje się aż tyle co w aromacie, pojawia się przyjemna słodycz kontrowana przez owocową kwaśność.

Aroma: Medium-high, rich raspberry with light molasses and tobacco. Soft alcohol notes. 
Appearance: Very dark, red body. Hazy. Light-brown head with fine bubbles. Low retention.
Flavour: Medium-high sourness (from the fruit I assume) on first sip. The sourness returns after every sip, but it makes the way for other flavours initially. Medium-light molasses and tobacco flavours make a appearance, more so as the beer warms up. Medium bitterness. Very dry finish with lingering sourness, raspberry and very light molasses.
Mouthfeel: Smooth, Full bodied. Medium-low carbonation. Medium warming.
Overall: The raspberry is front and center and it it both the first aroma and the last flavour. However, it nearly completely masks the base beer. The beer is a great experience regarding the sourness and the stronger/fuller beer.

330 ml bottle, poured. 
29A. Fruit Beer
26D. Belgian Dark Strong Ale

Piana beżowa, średnio pęcherzykowa, początkowo sycząca, ale pozostaje w postaci kożuszka do końca degustacji. Barwa rubinowa, wydaje się klarowna. W zapachu głównie kwaskowe maliny, słodki sok z malin, czerwone wino, melasa, rodzynki i trochę karmelu, likieru. W smaku powtórka, mega malinowe, żurawinowe (suszone żurawiny), kwaskowo słodkawe, oleiste, szczypiące od niedużego aczkolwiek drobnego nagazowania, winno taniczne w posmaku. Goryczki brak, alkohol ładnie wkomponowany, lekko rozgrzewający.

Zaskakujący quad, bardzo pozytywny i inny od klasycznych, aczkolwiek wolę trapistowskie podejście.
backlog. bottle. Dark brown with aroma of ripe raspberries, dried fruits. Jammy mouthfeel. Very heavy

Refrigerated 12.7 green bottle poured into s glass. Opaque dark brown with Crimson hues and medium beige head. Aroma is nice raspberry, medium body, medium/lower carbonation, and thin small-bubble lacing. Taste is raspberry, chocolate, and some alcohol.

Aromat truskawek, ziołowego likieru i odrobiny suszonych owoców. W smaku potężnie i słodko. Baza naprawdę robi wrażenie, jest jeszcze dopieszczona dodatkiem laktozy, ale przełamana kwaskowatością czerwonych owoców, ziołowością chmielu i mocarnym alkoholem. Dochodzi do tego posmak syropu na kaszel. Dziwne, ale fascynujące piwo. Choć nie wiem, czy podołałbym więcej niż 300ml.

330ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut!
Raspberry juice aroma. Taste also pure raspberry including the seeds. Heat tickles at the edges, but is never hot. Scary - theyve taken a fruit that is normally too sweet and fruity and made it dry, but also put a ton of alcohol in here and not smothered it behind a ton of sugar. OK, I quite like it now. However, I wouldnt brew this, Id just mix it from juice and spirits.
Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Aroma is sweet, sour, raspberry. Flavor is sweet, bitter, sour, raspberry. Finish is raspberry. Covers 13% rather well. Overall: good.

Bottle shared by Mart. Dark brown beer, smallish tan head. Nose is raspberry juice and dark malt. Flavor is more raspberry juice with dark malt. Acidity in the finish, more raspberry juice. Lingering malt notes, acidic raspberry. Alcohol well hidden behind the acidic raspberry juice.

ça sent le coulis de framboise de ma mère à plein nez ! Si le goût a un "je ne sais quoi" du crémeux dun crémet Nantais soutenu par le gourmand de lalcool ... Alors là ... Mais goûtons dabord la chose. Alors donc, cest pas très crémeux, mais pas mal sur lacide lactique et le fruit trop mûr ... Raide comme un trait de vinaigre sur un sorbet framboise sans sucre ...Côté alcool, on sent nettement que ça tape sur le carafon. En se réchauffant, cest plus agréable ... Japplaudis le parti pris exubérant, mais je reste sur le côté de la route ...

Flaske 375ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø - Langnes. Drukket på Bergstua 20 Mai 16. Ultradyprød. Rødskjær i skummet. Daler sakte. Litt lacing. Sterk bæraroma. Myk munnfølelse. Smaken har et intenst bærpreg. Heftig - men mangler variasjon.

Bottle from BarleyWine. Pours darkly ruddy with a large beige head tinged with pink - I think. Aroma of raspberry and something not familiar to me. Near full bodied. Flavor is lots of raspberry and darkish malt. Rather nice. Something like dessert.

Bottle @ home. Aroma of moderate malt, dark dried fruits and raspberry. Dark brown colour with off-white head, mostly diminishing. Taste is moderate sweet, light acidic from the raspberries, light bitter and some sweet alcohol. Medium body, oily feel, avg. carb., malty raspberry finish.
A deep red beer with a reddish head. The aroma has notes of raspberries, alcohol, and wood. The flavor is wood, alcohol, raspberries, and brettanomyces, leading to a tart finish.

Spéciale, peut être pas ma bière de prédilection mais vraiment bonne et réussie.
Bouquet très riche et gourmand : ultra framboise, du caramel, des raisins, du cassis, un peu de levure, un fond chocolaté, une acidité vineuse assez perceptible.
Bouche : très acide/amère, un peu dérangeant dailleurs, assez éc?urant. Létymologie narrange rien. Au delà de cette sensation que je naime pas, que du bon. En vrac : framboise, caramel, léger chocolat, des fruits noirs (cassis, mûre), un fond de levure et depices (cest bien une quadruple), un léger côté biscuit (ou cest moi qui veut à tout prix y trouver un pims !).
Finale très amère et éc?urante, éthylique, agressive.
Longueur assez acide, fraîche, fruitée, excellente.

Bottle. Pours an opaque dark brown with a thin lasting dark beige soft bubbly head. Aroma is of raspberries, chocolate, dark fruits, lactose, cherries, ginger. Taste is of cherries, raspberries, chocolate, ginger, lactose, raisins, figs, treacle, very sweet finish. Chewy oily mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation.

Sample at Mikkeller Beer tasting at Verkstedet, april 14th 2015. Muddy brown body, low beige head. Aroma of red wine, licorice, raspberries, spicy yeast. Taste is quite fruity with caramel, high sweetness, mild alcohol notes, belgian yeast lasting through a pleasing spice and berry aftertaste. Warm feel to the beer, quite good!

Bottle. Pours a murky reddish brown beer with a small white head on top. Aroma has massive raspberries, red fruits and caramel. Flavor is sweet and fruity, some boozey notes, silky mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Aftertaste is long, sweet and fruity. Nice beer.
Sehr fruchtiger, also himbeeriger Antrunk. Der Alkohol ist deutlich erkennbar, geringe Malzigkeit, süß-sauer. Die Himbeernoten bleiben stark, aromatisch, unsüffig. 10/12/5/10/8/10
Bottle. Quite a nice, strongly raspberry taste. There are some sour flavours there too.

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, raspberries, dried fruits and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter and light sour with a long warm, malty, sour raspberry and fruity finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
A lot of raspberry in aroma. Reddish dark brown color. Sour, bitter, sour, bitter - like waves, one for another, exactly in this way. A little sweet and nice sour aftertaste. Very nice!

Bottle. A dark brown, almost black one, with a creamy, finger-thick dark beige head leaving some lacing. The aroma has lots of raspberry, with some faint notes of chocolate, alcohol and dried fruits. The flavor has a healthy dose of sour raspberries, with a decent sweetness, some alcohol, a touch of roasted malts and dark sugar. Its full-bodied, warming and smoothly carbonated, with a lasting sweet, raspberry finish with some berry acidity. Well, its nice in a way, but at the same time its too much on the raspberry puree side and the alcohol impact is a tad heavy. Not bad for a 13% beer though. 151124

Bottle. Pours dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma of berries, some caramel, roasted malt, raspberries and alcohol. FLavor is sweet and fruity with some sour raspberries, rasperrie jam, some caramel and roasted notes. Medium body, avearge carbonation.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Krone - cloudy dark brown beer under a creamy beige head; clean and fair raspberry aroma, light herbal; full-bodied, velvety and fairly sweet; light sourish and long aftertaste of raspberries marmalade

Very deep brown body with a red hue. The head is tan with some pink blended in, its long-lived and laces the glass very well. Strong aroma of raspberries, raspberries and raspberries. Its quite one dimensional, its very hard to pick up anything else than this mix of tart and overripe raspberries. The strong flavour is similar, its acidic and tart raspberries all over the palate. In addition there are some faint generic fruity notes and some caramel in the back. The taste is moderate sweet and the long finish is light acidic. Full body, oily texture and soft carbonation. A nice one, but it gets a bit boring when the raspberries overpowers pretty much everything else. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 4 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]
Draft. Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are sweet raspberries and some booze.
Deep reddish brown with a frothy pink head. Aroma of deep, dark fruit. Full body, flavour of cherries, plums, light malt. Lightly sour.

Keg at Beer Temple, Amsterdam. Netherlands, Wednesday 7th October 2015.   Brown with a light frothy head. Wow this is raspberrytastic. Really lots of fresh. Zappy raspberries, tart, fruity and way to drinkable for the abv. This is wonderful nuff said. A8 A4 T9 P5 Ov17 4.3

Draught @ BeerTemple, Amsterdam.
Reddish brown, no head.
Pear drups, creamy with light sour. Sweetish. Interesting.
Fonefan 110415. Red amber colour with peachy head. Aroma is alcohol, raspberry, brett. Flavour is sweet, spices, sugar, alcohol, raspberry, brett. Full body. Nice beer.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 29A). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown (BBF 20/01/20). AROMA: raspberry aroma present with a background of caramelized and sweet malt. peppery alcohol notes. nice balance between malt and raspberry. APPEARANCE: very dark Brown color with ruby body against light. clear. large tanned and moussy head with good retention for the abv. some lacing from alcohol viscosity. TASTE: initial slight tartaric raspberry flavour followed by a balanced sweet caramelized and toasty malt. medium-low bitterness with a dry, slight acidic finish. nice balance. PALATE: full body with a velvety and creamy texture. moderate-high carbonation. alcohol warmth present. OVERALL: a very good belgian-style strong dark ale, with a precise flavour balance between a refreshing raspberry and malt.
Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. Is it a liquor or rather a sirup? Very strong, lots and lots and lots of raspberry, almost one-dimensional. Drink it slowly!

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2015 Botella 33 cl tomada en el momento en Belmonte _puertas 14-09-2015. Fdcons para 20-01-2020. (r59). Color marrón muy oscuro casi negro con tonos rojizos con bastante espuma al inicio con también tonos rojizos. Aromas intensos maltosos dulces y caramelos con ácidos de frutos del bosque. Sabores también intensos maltosos dulces con algo de caramelo tostado y ácido de arándanos. Toques de lactosa que lo suavizan todo un poco. Cuerpo intenso con 13 Vol que se notan desde el primer trago algo denso y bastante espumoso. Increíble explosión de sabores dulces y ácidos desde el primer trago al último que permanece en boca por un buen rato. Una maravilla de cerveza, para repetir sin duda. Original e imprescindible.

33cl bottle. Pours very dark brown with a huge beige/reddish head. Aroma of raspberries, dark malt, strong dark fruits. Taste is very sweet, tons of raspberries, dark malts, slight acid, some alcohol in the aftertaste, nice!

Brune aux reflets rouge. 

Nez: chocolat. Fruit. Vinaigre balsamique. Poivre. 

Bouche: belle acidité. Fruité. Fine chaleur d'alcool. Chocolat fourré au vinaigre balsamique. Framboise. Confiture de fraise. Très intéressant, j'aime beaucoup.

11sept15
-->Quadrupel brune, 13.0%, 330ml

-couleur chêne rouge, très opaque; mousse onctueuse 
-nez framboises, chocolat, crème 
-entrée surprenante (!), framboises sûres, présence du lactose évidente (texture -mouthfeel)
-ronde
-finale confitures, torréfaction, alcool (chaleur); acidulée, tranchante et astringente 
**devient plus onctueuse tempérée**
Co=4 Arô=4 Am=2.5 Su=1 Arr-g=3 Ac=4

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Looks..dark brown, dirty red hue, sml head
Smells..loads of raspberry, dark boozey dry fruits
Tastes..dominant raspberry, with dried fruits, semi roasty malts in the background along with some of the 13% booze. In the space of blank ink and blood but with the Belgian quad factor. Fucking yum!

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Sandefjord. Dark red color, some foam. High aroma intensity; raspberries( quite intense). Full body & medium high complexity. High immediate sweetness, some sourness- still a bit on the sweet side. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian - thanks a lot! Pours slightly hazy deep red with a pink head. Intense aroma of raspberries with mild malty notes. Quite acidic with lovely raspberry flavour and a surprisingly high drinkability. Different and quite interesting!

Loads of everything, dark, sweet, tart, belgian yeasty spice. Really does what is says, raspberry character is huge. Very intense brew, couldnt drink a lot of it but my 1/3 of the bottle was very nice.
Mørk brun/svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av røstet malt, bær og frukt. Smak av røstet malt, bær og frukt. Søt. Vinmonopolet.

Dark brown color, light brown head. Raspberry nose, coffee, caramel, hint of alcohol. Sweet taste, raspberries, sour note, caramel, chocolate malt, dry finish. Dangerously well hidden alcohol. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

Bottle from VP Aker Brygge enjoyed at home
Pours deep red with a thick pink head. Smell powerfully of raspberries, also dark er fruits, dark malts and yeast esters. Heavy sweet, moderate tart, nice raspberry acids, quite refreshing, a kick of booze, darker malts, fruity tendensies, berries. Moderate bitter, a bit tannins. Quite nice
Black with beige head. Fresh raspberries and some roasted malt. Sweet, tart, chocolate and caramel finish. Overall: Enjoyable! A little one dimentional. Well hidden alcohol.

Wow. Intense raspberry aroma and taste.. well I expected this one to be all about raspberries, but never expected so perfect implementation. Strong malty background, caramel, HQ raspberries all the way. Perfect balance between 
raspberry tartness and syrupy sweetness. Awesome brew!
Pours dark murky brown with thin beige head. Strong aroma of raspberry and spices. Raspberry dominates the taste as well. Sweet sour, very smooth, full bodied. Excellent

Pours murky brown low off white head
Aromas of raspberrries, liqourize, caramel, belgo yeast
Taste has raspberrie lemonade, hints of liqourize, sweet sweet caramel and brown sugar

Pours murky dark brown with flat head. Aroma of raspberry, licorice, nuts, almond icing. Taste is rich raspberry and dark fruit tart with fruity and funky sweet finish. Medium rich, sticky body with soft carbonation.

Distinctive berries in flavor, light sour and massive astringency in mouthfeel. Alcohol well hiden at start, later comes out a bit in aroma. Alcohol warm is noticable. Interesting brew, reminds kind of vinegar from raspberries. Could be more balances towards sweet, dry and malty.
Dark brown-red with small pink head. Raspberry aroma. Strong taste rich of good spirits notes mixed with good dose of raspberry.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are raspberries, malt, sugar, and a little tartness - with a warming finish.

Bottle. Pours a dark nougat brown hazy body with a large creamy light beige head. Nose is caramel, raspberries, burnt sugar, cinnamon, figs and hints of raisins, deep malts and nuts. Taste is raspberries, cinnamon, caramel, brown sugar and hints of lemon, bitter herbs, candi sugar and alcohol. Full body, medium carbonation. Way too heavy on the raspberries, the tartness more or less overpowers the substantial sweetness in the base of the beer. Fair enough, but not remarkable.

On tap at Mikkeller Reykjavik. Pours thick and dark brown with coffee color head. Aroma is similar to a quad yeasty with lots of roasted malt. Taste starts off with roasted malt then raspberry black currant takes over with a sour aftertaste. Really interesting and complex beer. Highly recommended!

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Dark red to brown, with a pink, forthy head. Raspberry nose. Alcohol. Vineous. Cherry and other red fruits. Sour. Medium to thick, oily mouth feel. Soft carbonation. Warming. Puckering. Raspberry, lingonberry, hint of sugar and malt flavour. The raspberries overshadowing all other flavours. Quite far fetched to call this a quadrupel - ratebeer does a better job putting this in the style of a fruit beer.

Bottle at cerveteca thanks to my buddy Scopey. Brown red color. Thin brown head. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. An interesting acidity, which remembers me some raspberry lambics. Aroma is super raspberried, wood and chocolate.

Bottle at Cerveteca Lisboa. It pours cloudy deep purple with a decent pinkish head. The nose is big juicy raspberry, sweet cherry, jammy, dried fruits, cherry drops, bakewell tart, black forest gateaux and candy. The taste is sweet, juicy, jammy, big raspberry character, light tartness, candy sugar, light alcohol, cherry drops, earth, wood, with some warming alcohol on the finish. Medium+body, moderate carbonation and slightly oily mouth-feel. Great fruit character and high drinkability. Niiiice.

Lukt: Bringebær.
Utseende: Nesten sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Preget bringeebærsmak, sursøt avslutning.
Hvor: Kjø[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Nettstore, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ hos Bryne, med Untapped gutta.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Mikkeller Raspberry Quadrupel ].Clear medium to dark red brown color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white to light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, sweet malt, raspberries. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate acidic with a long duration, tart raspberry, sugary, sweet malt. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20150411]

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Nice creamy head with excellent duration. Color is purple. Aroma and taste are a truckload of raspberries, malt, fruits and has a nice fruity finish. A bit cloying sweet, but still totally great.

Draught. Cewamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Dark red colour. Powerfull heavy malty and light hoppy nice raspberry aroma. Moderate bitter wonderfull raspberry flavor. Long complex nice finish. Creamy palate. Wonderfull.

Strong, dark and alcoholic beer with intense notes of raisins, prunes, malt and dark fruit. What makes it so interesting is the very successfull addition of raspberry which adds a very pleasant acidity to both aroma and taste. Lovely.
Clear rassberry aroma, light bitter medium sour, appear Dark Brown with a fine White head. Long sour aftertaste, full bodied with a soft carbonation

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 20/01/20. Ciemny, brazowy, wyglada na klarowny, choc to przy tak ciemnym piwie trudno ocenic... bardzo ladna, wysoka piana, lekko brazowawa, opadajaca srednio szybko, pozostajaca w postaci korzuszka i nieco rowniez brudzaca szklo. Aromaty quadruplowe, bardzo intensywne, slodowe, rodzynkowe, sliwkowe, karmelowe, lekko kawowe, zbozowe. Tytulowych malin prawie nie czuc w aromacie. Za to smak jest zdominowany (no, prawie zdominowany) przez bardzo kwaskowaty malinowy sok - ta dominanta zupelnie nie pasuje do aromatu. W tle jednak sa rowniez wyraznie wyczuwalne - choc przytlumione - nuty z aromatu, nuty faktycznie dobrego quadrupla. Sa tez jakies slodkie posmaki w tle - zapewne laktoza - niemniej fakt, ze Mikkeller to piwo ma w grupie "Sweet" to nieporozumienie. Zaskakujaca kombinacja. brak goryczki. Alkohol super dobrze ukryty (a wszak bardzo mocne piwo), srednie wysycenie. Bardzo ciekawa. w posmakach pozostaje wiecej quadrupla czy BDSA niz w samym smaku. Calosciowo: bardzo fajne. I fajnie inne - ewidentnie warte sprobowania.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Draught @ Fermentoren, Århus. Pours hazy dark brown with a creamy light tan head. Aroma of malt, light yeast, chocolate, sweet raspberry, dessert cake. Flavor is sweet, malty, caramel, chocolate, tart raspberries, soe bitter fruit, alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, alcohol shows but is still fairly well hidden for the ABV. 290415

On tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a deep, clear red with a frothy, reddish brown head. Aroma has lots of sweet raspberries, but certainly also some sweet, toasted malts. Slight chocolate and hints of fig-stick with raspberries. Taste is more tart from the raspberries, but as it heats up, it gets a lot of these sweeter, chocolate, malt and fruit notes. Better than the tripel, but im not entirely convinced by the concept.. Full body, low carb, well hidden alcohol.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2015 Tap. Pours dark redish brown with thick creamy cream/slight pink head. Aroma is raspberries, tart, vannill, liquorice, oak, malty, slight chocolate and subtle dryfreezed raspberry. Only slight booze. Taste is way more acidic than expected. Tart raspberry, malts, raspberrie, chocolate acidic to keep up with the sweetness. Vanilla, oak and liqorice. Quite dry finish. Full body, medium carbonation. Slight warming alcohol. Quite enjoyable, more that expected.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus, 13%. Very dark brown/red with big creamy beige head. Aroma is malt, raspberries, fruit, little sour, yeast and dark fruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, sweet, raspberries, dark fruits, sour, little tart, oak and a little acid.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm.

A bit hazy ruby red with a small head. Aroma and taste of raspberry, some alcohol, malt and light caramel. Sweet and with a long finish.

@ mikkeller Stockholm 15-4-25: en riktig bra öl med tydlig toner av körsbär och svarta vinbär. Riktig fin balansen. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
---- Soberness not garanteed!

Aroma is raspberries, sweet malts and some alcohol as well. Flavour is fruity, floral, wooden and quite strong raspberries, syrup and some sugary notes. Still a nice somewhat tart raspberry finish to it.

Podstawowy aromat jest polaczeniem malin, likieru, octu winnego i melasy. W smaku mimo poteznego ciala alkohol swietnie ukryty, idealny balans. kwasne, winne, lekko korzenne, wedzone, oprócz tytulowych kwasnych likierowych malin rzadzi przypalona skórka chleba, suchego siana i kawy zbozowej.Przyjemna degustacja.

Bottle @ Post-Easter Procrastination, Ulfborg. Pours hazy very dark ruby with airy beige head. Clear aroma of berries and malt, with notes of caramel. Vinous flavour of berries, with sweet notes of caramel malt and touches of hops. Vinous aftertaste. Warming alcohol presence. A good fruit beer.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy reddish brown with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, raspberry and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 110415

(Keg at HBF2015) The beer poured dark brown and cloudy. Its head was small and white. Aroma had raspberries, roasted malts and solvent. Palate was full bodied and burning with medium carbonation. Flavours were raspberries, chocolate, a lot of booze, tartness, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was messy and bitter. A weird boozy mess.

Draught @ HBF 2015 

Pours dark reddish brown with a small head. Aroma of berries, ripe fruits, raisins and malts. Taste is sweet, artificial and syrupy with loads of raspberries, ripe fruits, raisins and yeast. Finish is sweet, syrupy and sticky with loads of raspberry juice, hints of raisins and toffee. Heavy, sweet and sticky. Unbalanced.
Tap at HBF 2015, Helsinki. Colour is reddish brown with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Berries, raspberries and sweetness. Horrible.
Draught @ HBF15. Dark brown colored, thin off white head. Raspberry aroma, sweetness, marmalade. Flavor has raspberry marmalade. Very sweet. Alcohol. Ok in very small doses.

Fat på Mikkeller bar. 
Luktar hallon blandat med hostmedicin. 
Tydlig hallonsyrlighet med en druvjuicekänsla.
Spritig. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark ruby colour with poor head, but with quite good lacing. Sweet, malty aroma with dried plums, raisins and some sourness. Taste is also sweet and malty with dried fruits and fresh sour raisins.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Pours dark brown with a thin brown head, both of which have a red hue. Fresh aroma of raspberry juice, sugar, lemon, alcohol. The taste starts sour and ends sweet and fruity. One-dimensional.

26-MAR-2015, draft @Mikkeller & Friends.
Dark brown with a tan head but both the Brown and the tan have a red hue.
Aroma is heavy raspberry - vitamin pill-like.
Taste is very much vitamin as well. Hard to sense much else. Some malty stuff but just as a base for the raspberry. Very sweet, perhaps a bit simple, full body, soft carbonation.
OK but the raspberry thing is overdone. Shadowing the beer underneath.

Tap. Deep brown body with a small off-white head. Aroma of raspberries, dried fruit, cocolate notes and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and slightly bitter. Medium to full bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Quad.

On tap at Mikkeller&Friends. Pours an opaque black with a small off-white head. Quite sweet with lots of raspberry aromas. Also notes of dark chocolate and cherry sauce. Full bodied. Hints of alcohol. Medium to soft carbonation. Bitter finish with more raspberry jam.

Draught at Mikkeller&Friends. Dark almost black - offwhite head. Lots of raspberries. Zesty. Acid fruity. Sweetness. Light burned feeling. Nutty. Rubber. Light citrus. Bitter notes. Dry bitter raspberry finish.

Pitch black color with light brown slightly pink foam. The smell is amazing. A bouquet of forest fruits enters your nose. Blackberry, cassis, raspberry and an accompanying sweetness. The taste is too sweet. The fruitiness is still there but with a short tart feeling and a dry aftertaste. A good one no doubt, but its a bit overdone.
Dark brown color with red highlights. Intense raspberries, nearly artificial, and spicy yeasts. Fruity raspberries. Sweet, but not sugary. A different beer, a dark one without chocolate presence.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown ruby color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy strong raspberry aroma. Sweetish fruity spicy raspberry flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy raspberry finish.
33 cl. bottle. Dark red/brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of caramel, dried fruit, raspberries, oak and alcohol.

Bottled. Dark burgundy coloured. Small beige dense head. Aroma. Raspberry, ripe fruits, spice, alcohol, sweetness. Flavour. Raspberry, sweetness, alcohol, grape, spice. Medium to full bodied. ENds fruity and grapy.

Bottle at yespr.
Clear red-brown colored with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel, dried fruits and raspberries.
Sweet and fruity flavor of caramel, raspberries and oak with notes of dried fruits.
Sweet and warming alcoholic finish.

33 cl bottle. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is dense raspberry and light alcohol presence. Dense syrupy fruity. Warming quad base. Lingering fruity and smooth sweet finish. Thick and mild citric finish.
